channel.title: Posts on Dominic Musgrave
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dominic Musgrave

item.title: Mandarin: To Be or Not To Be
item.description: Maybe it’s 没不？ To be or not to be? To 是 or 不是， or is it to 有 or 没有？ 不有？ As part of my efforts to learn Mandarin, I’m going to explain 不 (bu) and 没 (méi). 有 - yǒu - to have or to exist. Essentially, 有 means “to have” or “to exist,” while 没有 means “to not have” or “to not exist.” The character 没 negates 有, making it the negative form.

item.title: Autopsy of Mixtape.Party: Lessons from a Failed Side Project
item.description: This article reflects on the journey and lessons learned from developing mixtape.party. Despite its failure, the project provided insights into market validation, competition, and the importance of targeted marketing and time allocation.

item.title: Expression Value Categories in C++ - I like to move it move it.
item.description: What is an expression? It’s a bit of code that returns a value, something like int i = 0; Here an expression returns a variable, i, with a value of 0. Expressions can be literals, like 0, or variables, like i, but they can also be references, pointers, etc. Values are defined by two independent properties: has identity can be moved What are the value categories? Before C++11, there were L values and R values.

item.title: Automated Testing in Game Development
item.description: At Rare, we use automated testing when developing games and it is hugely beneficial. This is a great tech talk on it.

item.title: Making a Lorenz Attractor in go
item.description: What A Lorenz Attractor is a chaotic system developed by Edward Lorenz. It’s related to the butterfly effect as the image it produces resembles a butterfly and the idea behind it gives rise to the idea that a butterfly flapping it’s wings in Brazil can cause a hurricane in the US. More accurately, it’s an example of a system where tiny changes or errors in the process cause completely different outcomes.
